title: Judge to hear arguments on moving Freddie Gray trials
content: , file photo, family members of Freddie Gray, sister Fredricka Gray, left, mother Gloria Darden, center, and stepfather Richard Shipley listen during a news conference after a day of unrest following the funeral of Freddie Gray in Baltimore. Gray's parents reached a tentative $6.4 million settlement with the city of Baltimore. The deal, announced Tuesday, Sept. 8, 2015, appeared to be among the largest settlements in police death cases in recent years and happened just days before a judge is set to decide whether to move a trial for six officers charged in Gray's death. (AP Photo/Evan Vucci, File)
